document.docAuthor: Gess, Friedrich W. & Gess, Sarah K.
document.masterDocTitle: Geographical distributions of Bembix (Hymenoptera, Crabronidae, Bembicinae) in southern Africa, with notes on biology

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Geographical distributions of Bembix (Hymenoptera, Crabronidae, Bembicinae) in southern Africa, with notes on biology

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Albany Museum and Rhodes University, Grahamstown, 6139 South Africa
Albany Museum and Rhodes University, Grahamstown, 6139 South Africa

figureCitation.captionText: Figure 11. Bembix species: a Bembix karroensis, female, male b Bembix liturita, female, male c Bembix loupata, male d Bembix melanopa, female, male e Bembix moebii, female, male f Bembix monedula, female, male. (approximate lengths of - females: a 15.5 mm; b 16 mm; d 15.5 mm; e 21 mm; f 24 mm - male: c 15 mm)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Recorded from four plant families: Apiaceae (
Foeniculum vulgare
Mill.); Apocynaceae (formerly Asclepiadaceae ); Asteraceae (
Athanasia trifurcata
(L.) L.); and Aizoaceae (Mesembryanthema, "mesem" ).
Three nests recorded at Hilton, near Grahamstown, Eastern Cape - all single celled, sloping burrows in sloping friable soil, the main shaft ended in a spur.
Recorded taking seven families of Diptera : Tabanidae , Bombyliidae , Syrphidae , Muscidae , Calliphoridae , Sarcophagidae , and Tachinidae .
